texto: characteristics. Each stage has a distinct purpose and contribution to planning and executing the whole life cycle of the software system. Per ISO/IEC TS 24748‚Äê1, the typical system life cycle stages include concept, development, production, utilization, support, and retirement. Use of these terms to define stages is not normative. A common set of stages for a software system is concept exploration, development, sustainment, and retirement, with transitions between stages for the system as a whole and for its elements. The stages represent the major life cycle periods associated with a software system and they relate to the state of the software system description or the software system
